intro: Selago tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed selago, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Selago tenuicaulis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
